website_summaries.verdict: This stroller is the ultimate in portability. The perfect stroller if space is at a premium or if you travel frequently.
pros: Folds down to 11.8" x 13.8", which is small enough to fit under an airplane seat
Durable fabric that still maintains a soft feel
cons: Telescoping handles have some give when extended

website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for traveling, this is an incredibly lightweight stroller that offers reliability and easily folds up  to be extra compact in size.
pros: This stroller really stands out for its remarkable lightweight and compact design that can easily be carried and stored on the go
We also love that it is reliable over time, comfortable for little ones, sturdy in design, and can be steered with one hand in a pinch
cons: Some parents felt that the frame can feel shaky on certain terrains, and it can be a bit more cumbersome to unfold than some models

customer_reviews.title: You can wear as a backpack
customer_reviews.text: Love love this stroller I bought it for Disneyland since last time we went it was a nightmare to get the huge stroller we had in and out of the trans not to mention having to push it around the park even when my kid wanted to walk around. This stroller is so small I bought backpack straps and carabiners to attach to the stroller and wear it as a backpack so I can be hands free while not using it and my invention work like a charm I'll attach the backpack straps and carabiners I used below FOLAI Adjustable Waterproof Replacement Shoulder Strap Replacement Shoulder Straps Adjustable Belt for Shoulder Bag Backpack Black
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: This stroller has everything I ask for
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a perfect travel stroller for a while and I am so glad I got this model. Yes, this stroller is slightly heavier than the original gb pockit, but it offers so much more. - With folded size 13.4 * 7.9 * 16.5, it takes minimum space at home, and fits airplane overhead storage. - Front wheel suspension brings more comfort to the little passenger. - The canopy is larger than the original model, so it’s going to be actually useful. - Other improvements: the structure feels sturdier, self-stand when folded, and wider seat. I’ll report back after our flight+cruise trip. But so far, we’re happy about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BAO

customer_reviews.title: Max weight is 33 Lb... what a shame, gb
customer_reviews.text: I am very angry. I just bought the stroller for my 5 yr old boy, because it is supposed to carry up to 55lb. When I read the warnings, it says that the kid max weight should not exceed 33 lb. I cant believe it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received it today. Haven’t used it yet, but I’m giving it 5 stars just because of the size it folds to. It is unbelievable, that a stroller that holds up to 55 pounds and can carry my very heavy and big 3 year old, can be folded and put in my backpack. I will update this review if anything goes terrebly wrong, but if the stroller is ment to make traveling easier, I’ll keep the 5 stars even if the fold requires a few extra steps, and getting it into my kanken backpack takes a few minutes. So far, impressed. PS. The fajllraven kanken backpack it fits into is the 17 inch laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Begoña Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good for tall toddlers but not for tall parents; very poor handling
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing, and I had high hopes. Toddler was comfortable (she's skinny and lanky -- this is probably too narrow for for brawny kids). Maybe the one I got was defective, but it handled extremely poorly with her (28lbs) sitting in it. It kept veering every which way so that I was constantly fighting with the stroller. There was just too much flex in the frame and the telescoping handle, like a cheap rollaway suitcase. Also, I really don't recommend this stroller if you're tall. I'm 5'9" and between fighting the stroller and the low height of the handles, my low back was a mess.
customer_reviews.author: polecat

customer_reviews.title: one of the Wheel broke down after 5 months. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: before the wheel problem happens, I loved it. light weight, easy maneuverability, nice folding... We didn't even use it much because of the social distancing this year. But after only 5 months, one of the wheels broke down. This stroller was designed with wheels not replaceable. Remind me never ever buy another mini wheeled stroller again! ( My previous one was a mountain buggy nano, retired also because of wheels problem, but that one at least lasted over 2 years).
customer_reviews.author: Diana Mars

customer_reviews.title: Great travel stroller
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from Mexico with this stroller and it is exactly the travel stroller I was looking for. We always buy seats at the front of the plane and one of the benefits of this is the ability to get to customs ahead of much of the plane. With a traditional stroller tou either have to check it (and not have it in the airport) or gate check it (and watch the plane empty while you wait for the crew to bring up gate checked items). This fits easily under the seat in front of your child or in the overhead bin. My nearly 40 lbs, tall 2yo fit comfortably. Folding does take a bit of practice.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Light, simple, and sturdy for the win
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a small stroller to use for travel because my jogging stroller (which I love) takes up so much space in the trunk. I ordered this with high hopes and was not disappointed. It folds up very small and is lightweight. It was super easy to collapse and erect. It also felt very sturdy. I was impressed by the coverage of the sunshade. The recline and wheel lock features were easy to use. The handlebar height adjustment is great for us as well!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Stroller EVER!
customer_reviews.text: WE LOVE THIS STROLLER! My husband originally purchased it because I was afraid to take our big stroller on the plane to gate check. I was traveling alone, so ease of use and portability was really important. I was amazed at how convenient it was to collapse and slide under my seat on the plane and maneuvered well through the airport and throughout our trip. I received multiple compliments and a few mom's even asked me where to buy one. Since then, we have been on a few more flights and many excursions and are still in love with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT all-terrain, Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: This stroller folds compactly and is fairly lightweight. However, the "all-terrain" is definitely NOT all-terrain. It won't go through grass, any kind of gravel, or uneven terrain at all. It also feels cheap and flexes quite a lot when turning, and the handles could extend longer (and I am only 5'3" tall). Definitely not worth the $200 plus price tag. I am quite disappointed with it since it is advertised as all-terrain. It is also quite difficult to fold and lock together. I would recommend you go for a folding wagon style with actual all terrain wheels if you are looking for something that folds smaller but will work on all types of terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the GB family
customer_reviews.text: I wanted another GB stroller, as I have been using the Pockit for several years on cruises, Europe trips, Disney, etc. It has been great. I wanted one that would fit the Pocket, so if only 1 kid wants a stroller, we could give them an option. The Pockit fits in the bottom of the City, so we can easily carry it around with both kids if one wants to walk.
customer_reviews.author: C James

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for travel - then Covid hit...
customer_reviews.text: We initially purchased this stroller for upcoming travel in airports and cities (Boston and NYC), however, that trip was cancelled due to Covid, so we have yet to actually USE this stroller. That being said, I really love its design, sleekness, and compact nature. The only con I have from using it around our house briefly is the maneuverability. It's definitely not as sturdy as a standard stroller, or even perhaps an umbrella stroller - mainly because it needs to fold up into such a small size. I don't think it's a huge deterrent, but it's something to consider for the terrain you'll be using it on.
customer_reviews.author: Allison A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a compact solution, but not as a main stroller.
customer_reviews.text: The Pockit would drive me crazy as my main stroller - for long walks and hauling lots of gear. However for something compact, nothing comes close- we literally bought this in order to put the Pockit in the basket of other strollers for times when we're going somewhere as a family but my husband and I need to part ways after the outing and will each need a stroller. Or if we're going separate directions with separate children in the morning and meeting up later. It fits really nicely in the basket of several of our other strollers - and has quite the edge over other "compact" strollers like the nano, yoyo, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Chana

customer_reviews.title: Will do the job
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful stroller, easy to carry n good foldable size so very convenient if wants something small enough. However, I return it not only cause I believe it wouldn't last long since the quality doesn't seem as good n my daughter is 2 years old n did not seem as comfortable on this one like she did on the delta lightweight stroller. Perfect for those who are smaller n don't do as much travelling since who knows how long the stroller would last.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Defective stroller?
customer_reviews.text: I really feel like I received a defective stroller. It is extremely difficult to fold up to put away and extend out again. Even my husband who is a big man has trouble putting it away. Unfortunately I found this out while on my vacation, so we dread having to use this stroller. It doesnt say how to reach out to the seller, but I am hoping that the one I received was a dud and they can exchange mine out for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stroller, great for travel or small cars!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is incredible as it folds really small so you dont need to gate check it at the airport, you can put it in the overhead! That will save you lots of time and its also easy to pop in and out so super easy to use. The stroller is comfortable and although for a small stroller its a bit on the pricey side, its the only one that folds so small! Also great for travel because it barely takes up any trunk space! Highly recommend as a great travel option that legit will save you time and space!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Super satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight and compact. It’s also so comfortable that my son is just sitting in it as a chair in our hotel room. It feels a little flimsy though and obviously does not have the same comforts as a delux stroller system. But then again, you’re usually not carrying a delux stroller as carry on for a plane . I gave the review for ease if folding 4 stars as a caution - if you want to user super-compact mode, it is not a one handed fold. But for a super compact design that fits under an airplane seat or in a backpack, this is pretty easy to fold and unfold.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Baechle

customer_reviews.title: Great travel stroller but no carrying case!
customer_reviews.text: We fly with our baby girl, A LOT. This is so compact. We get her out and quickly fold it down and it goes through TSA easily. I only gave it a 4 because it doesn't come with a carrying case, only a short, rubber handle type thing to hold it once it's folded down and locked. If it included a case, it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neat engineering, but a crappy STROLLER
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Yes it folds small and is lightweight. But if you’d like it to actually function as a STROLLER, get something else! (Check out the baby jogger city tour). The canopy is useless, it’s impossible to push one handed, the seat is very shallow, and the basket is relatively useless (holds a windbreaker). The fold isn’t that great. You definitely need to make sure it’s all the way open as I’ve had it collapse while putting my kid in it (fortunately no one was hurt). Agreed that it’s neat, and pulls as your desire to have a real-live transformer, but I wouldn’t by this again and I don’t use it now.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin E Raven

customer_reviews.title: BEST PURCHASE EVER
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give this stroller 10 stars!!!! BEST PURCHASE EVER!!!! Went on a overseas trip with a 2 year old, an 8 month old, this stroller, a baby carrier, and a backpack. Would not have made it without it. Definitely worth every penny! Very very easy to maneuver one handed, excellent wheel structure. Both kids took turns and were comfortably seated at all times. The storage space underneath is absolutely great! And of course, the best part, not having to wait for 15 min at the bridge of the airplane with 2 sleepy children for them to bring the stroller back (made everyone jealous!! They were all asking where I found this life-saver). No more umbrella strollers.....
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Compact yet pricey & so not worth it
customer_reviews.text: at first I thought this stroller was a dream come true because it’s light weight, takes up very little space and was going to be easy to open and close. It’s easy to unfold most times but I look like a moron trying to close it 9 out of 10. Literally has to be hot to close with ease. We’ve owned it for 6 months and I am ready to burn it. Also, the wheels SUCK after a couple months- turns like an old grocery store cart. I take VERY good care of my things, especially ones that cost this much. This stroller sucks.
customer_reviews.author: PickyMama

customer_reviews.title: Useful at the airport
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller it’s so useful when going to the airport and I don’t have to check it under the plane. The only thing is it gets stuck sometimes just to push it down. Otherwise, it’s awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Melly

customer_reviews.title: If you've got a tall kid, this is the stroller for you
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 year-old who is 43" tall. Most strollers are way too small and uncomfortable for her. This stroller was the perfect size. We're planning a trip to disney, and I like that this folds small so we can take it with us. Although the weight was listed in the description, I found this a bit heavier than I thought it was going to be. You also can't fold or unfold it one handed, just remember that.
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: Great if you don’t use it a lot 😒
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is far over priced. It’s a fantastic idea and realistically was awesome, until we started using it all the time! We travel a lot so we thought this would be perfect... whereas it’s amazing because it’s easy to pack & carry while traveling.. it sucks on any surface that isn’t pavement, is difficult to fold sometimes, and doesn’t recline or have any shade/cover. If it were less expensive I’d say get it!! However, i think there are far better options out there for travel strollers
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Not for taller parents.
customer_reviews.text: The good: Good for travel due to fold size. You can jam a good amount of stuff in the bottom pocket. The meh: The instructions for could be a little better as it did take me several tries before I fully understood how to fold it. The wheels are small, so they are more likely to get stuck on rough terrain, even sidewalk cracks. The bad: My husband, who is 5'11, is too tall to comfortably push this stroller, so I ended up having to ferry the child around the whole trip. Not very sturdy considering price.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: One word: awesome
customer_reviews.text: We took this on our trip to Florida with our 10 month old, and were so glad we got it. In fact, even at home, we now use it more than our traditional stroller. How small it gets just makes it so convenient and easy to just throw in the car when going somewhere. At first, we had some difficulty getting it to fold. We just had to practice a few times, to figure out the easiest way to do this. Since then, it's been awesome.
customer_reviews.author: DragonKing

customer_reviews.title: portable but not stable
customer_reviews.text: the only great is the portability. It's still pretty heavy and closing and opening isn't as quick and easy as all the videos demonstrate. It does not pop open easy without a little more effort than a shake. Closing can be challenging with the two back wheels completely closed up for better compact closures. Usage isn't as smooth and it wobbles due to the weak framing. So it's not stable when pusjongntour child around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Folds up very small, just a pain to fold up
customer_reviews.text: Stroller folds up small, which is awesome. Problem is that it is difficult to fold. Takes me a while to finally do it, my wife can’t fold it up at all, and if it’s wet or dirty, I get wet or dirty too. Maneuvers better than any umbrella stroller we have. Although I do kick the bottom as I’m pushing it sometimes due to its low/short handles and I’m only 5’9”. No real storage on it, we bought cup holders for it but you have to take them off it fold it up which is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Yeezy

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to fold quicker! Shake your hands when pushing the buttons!
customer_reviews.text: Had my doubts when my wife wanted this expensive stroller instead of a cheaper disposable one but after one year of use, I think this have been a great investment. It’s very sturdy and have tolerated a lot of abuse. My model doesn’t have the recline strap and luckily it never was needed because my kid don’t like to be lie down when he sits on the stroller! And it doesn’t seem uncomfortable either! I use it to make him sleep on it every day! This is a must have for many parents
customer_reviews.author: DavidC

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Stroller Ever
customer_reviews.text: Going through the airport and theme parks with this stroller is amazingly easy, it is way easier than lugging a heavy Graco stroller and it takes so much less space in the trunk. We used this for two out of town trips and it is slowly becoming my errand stroller around town since I don't feel like struggling with the heavier one anymore. The only ding is the sunshade - it doesn't do much, I used a muslim cotton blanket draped over the top to block out the sun so it is an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Snortus Malortus

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to Tokyo to use with my 4 year old who was 40lbs. When I took it out of the box at home it felt flimsy. I tried it out in the house and it still felt flimsy, but I took it anyways to our trip...surprisingly it didn’t feel as flimsy as it did at home on carpet! It is definitely a great buy, my husband agrees, but he said that he wishes the handles were a bit taller (he is 6’). With my daughter in a bulky jacket...she fit comfortably in the seat, it doesn’t recline, but she had no issues falling asleep.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Decent Travel Stroller
customer_reviews.text: Folds incredibly small which is what I was looking for so it's great for traveling. It does feel a little unsturdy but not bad for a travel stroller. Wish it had a little bit of recline which they could have accomplished by adding zippers. Canopy is pretty much useless and it needs a carry strap when folded.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size! Lightweight and durable.Used on the old brick streets of Newport, RI and busy crowded places like NYC. Currently living in Japan and this stroller is perfect here. Good for museums, shopping, restaurants, etc. I ride the bus and train often and it’s been helpful to be able to fold it up. I just need a strap to carry when not in use. We don’t have a backpack that it can be carried in. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because the sunshade that comes with it really is too small and doesn’t do anything for protection. Practice a few times folding it and opening it up. Daughter is now 3-years-old and 30 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Flo85

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a light weight and small stroller to keep in the car without getting the the way. It's super light and easy to fold! I'm still getting used to opening it, lot of people will jerk it open... Which I haven't gotten the hang of yet lol As of my son, he is 2 years old and he honestly enjoyed riding in it. Which is very out of norm for him. We tried maybe stroller and he hated all of them, but this one he went in happily! Since I ordered the Air pockit, the whole back is mesh and it's great for the hot weather in Hawaii. So that's a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna M. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t take up much space. Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product for someone with little space in their car for a stroller. Our daughter is two but taller than an average two yr old. Her length will cause her to grow out of this stroller quickly unfortunately. The wheels on this stroller are not made for any bumpy surface and also does not work in grass. The shade is a waste and doesn’t even cover half of the child in the stroller
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great to save room but may lack in quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love the compactness and lightness of the product but lacks in sturdiness. After setting it up, it felt a little flimsy, but still capable of doing its job. Another issue that arose, is the way my little one sit in it. The support for the back is not great and to pull the string in the back to make it straighter seems to hardly do anything. I recommend sitting your child in one to make sure you like the fit before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Vivi

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE LOVE LOVE this stroller! Perfect for travel and so handy to have. LO was very comfortable in it and would always fall asleep (he hates strollers) which is always a blessing. We took it to Hawaii and it was a hit! We have had issues folding it up (not use to it I guesd) and I wish the company made a sunshade for this stroller (the one that we purchased through recommendations on Amazon was a cheap thing and didn't work well). Also the basket underneath is VERY small so Mamas that put their purse there you'll need to find another way to carry your stuff. Overall we highly recommend this! Would definitely purchase again :)
customer_reviews.author: aprilfang

customer_reviews.title: ... this stroller but in the end I couldn't be happier that I did
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth so many times about whether or not to spend the money on this stroller but in the end I couldn't be happier that I did. It was perfect for our trip to NYC, DC, and LA with a two year old. Love how compact it folds up. We walked a ton sobusee it heavily, and when we were in museums or restaurants, or planes/trains/buses and didn't want to take up too much space we could just fold it up!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Sprouse

customer_reviews.title: I love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. We went on trip to Europe and I am so glad we had this. Now they don’t let you get your stroller at the airplane gate, you will get it at your final destination, so having a fully folded stroller is must. Also we used it every where, some places had very tiny elevators so we could squeeze in with this one, where a regular stroller won’t fit. The other thing is that it’s more comfortable that an umbrella stroller. The other thing I liked is that the cover is easy to remove and wash in washer machine. I really recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Shb08

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Some friends of ours had this same stroller and we were amazed at how great it was. It folds up super small, small enough to fit under the seat of an airplane. We used it on a plane and it was such a smooth transition during boarding and de-planing. It's durable, although its best on smooth paved surfaces. Its not a great off-road stroller. It has just enough storage below it to through the essentials in the pouch. Very sturdy construction, the straps are easy to use and our son finds it pretty comfy!
customer_reviews.author: heynash

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good little stroller
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice stroller great for narrow spaces. Great for small apartments it’s good overall. A bit wobbly I was expecting a sturdier stroller but I guess it needs to be light to be able to collapse and easy to carry. It’s easy to push the canopy is useless. I would never pay full price for a stroller like this but I’m going on vacation and needed a light compact stroller. I bought it with a gift card so it was very affordable for me but I wouldnt spent that much( full price) on a stroller like this.
customer_reviews.author: virginia chomin

customer_reviews.title: High quality, not quite what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to fold, and folds much smaller than i expected. I didn't realize that it can't accommodate a car seat and have the fabric seat installed at the same time. You need to remove the fabric seat, (which was quite a chore), then you can put the car seat in in the frame. It's modular, so the bassinet configuration will depend on you having a basinet that i presume is either sold separately, our a different version of the stroller. I was under the impression what i bought would do everything i saw in the pictures Still happy with the product quality though.
customer_reviews.author: Stirling Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Buy the stroller now, thank us later.
customer_reviews.text: 1 the shade does not cover the child at all! The shade is super thin as well. 2 does not recline 3 the storage bag is extremely small and difficult to put items in at times. All these 3 you will read them on the rest of the reviews and they are very true. We purchased the stroller for our family vacation and it did not disappoint minus the fact that the handles to turn the stroller looked sideways at the end of the day. Stroller is super easy to fold and put away. We are happy with our purchase, wish we would have purchased it sooner. ***we purchased it knowing the reviews and took the risk***
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Must have if traveling
customer_reviews.text: Small and lightweight. Perfect for traveling because it can be a carry-on item. (Just find a good eco-bag that it fits in nicely so it's easier to pack and carry around.) Fits in trunks and backseats easily. Folding it takes some practice, but once you figure it out it's quick. As an everyday stroller it lacks the ability to hang a baby bag or groceries, etc. It is light so the added weight of hanging bags makes it fall over when baby is taken out. It's also flimsy if you decide to go off road with it through the park. All in all perfect for traveling but not for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Nugs

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for travel
customer_reviews.text: This was the best purchase I made for our trip to Cancun with my 6 month old. We used it every single day! He was comfortable enough to even take naps in it. I loved how small it folds and got a lot of complements on it. We were able to carry it right onto the plane and put it in the over head container without issue. The folding has a learning curve but once we got the hang of it, it was easy. The sun cover is too small to do much, so we did buy a detachable one to hook on the stroller when in the sun and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Best portable stroller ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. It fits in a fairly standard sized backpack! Sometimes I carry my baby in a carrier and this stroller in a backpack on my back to pick up my 5 year old from school. When she gets tired of walking, I just whip this out of the backpack and were good to go. Also fits in the basket of my baby's stroller, which is great for when the older 2 want to walk and we don't have to push an empty stroller around.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nissan juke and I have hardly any space in the trunk. When I have all three of my kids in the car, I have very little room to store things. I absolutely love how compact the stroller is. And how I can take it apart or put it together in less than 10 seconds. I get compliments on this all the time. I got to use this at Six Flags, and it was so useful. Especially in those last minute seconds where I had to fold the stroller up to get on the bus or walked up a hill or stairs.
customer_reviews.author: JupiterRayne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for trips! We just leave this in my car. A friend of mine bought this for their airplane trip and she said it fit perfect in the overhead bin! It's not as sturdy as a normal stroller BUT a normal stroller doesn't fold up small enough to fit in a planes oberhead bin sooooo I didn't expect a lot of structure to it. More sturdy than I expected though to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: not as describe
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is not as easy fold as it described, it took me almost 2 minutes to unfold it. Also, the stroller is not sturdy for my 35lbs kid neither. It's very convenient for traveling, but I still decided to return it.
customer_reviews.author: SPH

customer_reviews.title: Compact and handy
customer_reviews.text: Folds up so small, I can keep it in the back of my car. At first I worried it might collapse while I was using it, but after many long walks around the city, I have a feel for when it is fully snapped into place and it is pretty sturdy. The storage underneath is pretty useless, and I still wish it had a cupholder of some kind even though I know that is impractical for the design. Overall, Very glad I bought it as a complement to my large jogging stroller when I need a small stroller in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: ahomebrewer

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY!
customer_reviews.text: Traveled solo with my toddler to New York and this stroller saved me! SO CONVENIENT! I bought the bag but holding it without the bag was just as easy since it’s so light weight! Also can be taken into the plane and stored under the seat or in the bins above! I liked doing this because I’ve had a bad experience of a previous stroller not getting to my next flight :(
customer_reviews.author: Mark Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 3 year old son for a trip to NYC didn’t even make it though the airport before breaking. He’s 32lbs. So upset. We really needed this stroller which we specifically bought for this trip. For $150 I would expect much higher quality in an umbrella stroller. Should have gone with a cheapo old school for $50!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: This is garbage!!! Using this is like wiping your hands on the ground
customer_reviews.text: TRASH! The buttons you have to press require your fingers to be in contact with feces, excrement and any disgusting things youll find in a city street these wheels have been in contact with. This is extremely difficult to fold up. One wheel wont even fold up so its sticking out and makes it impossible to close. Why even take it on a trip? This would be super frustrating and ruin my outing. Ive only had it for 15minutes and I wanna throw it in the dumpster. If you wanna have a difficult trip this is the stroller for you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller two years ago for a long trip to Europe. Needed something to withstand cobblestones and tiny cafes. It's performed great since then: quick to open, fits into a tote bag, lightweight, takes a beating. We regularly get compliments on it when taxi drivers, hostesses, etc see how tiny it can fold. Two drawbacks: it's a little short, so if you're 6 ft tall like me, you'll have to crouch over to walk with it. Also, if you hang a diaper bag, purse etc on the handles, it tips over immediately when your kid gets out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Awesome Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Well this thing is incredible. First let me say that my biggest fear was that I would not be able to figure out how to fold and unfold this thing . As a first time parent I have noticed a trend of baby items being designed to torture tired New parents . Nevertheless this stroller is aweosme and supppppper easy to open and close. It is incredible how small it becomes . Order the bike strap thing to strap it to the stroller so u can carry it over the shoulder, because seriously, how many people are using the space in the bag to put a stroller in
customer_reviews.author: mariya

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my toddler son. We plan on carrying this stroller in a JuJuBe Super Be bag when we next go to Disney. We used our Graco stroller at Disney many many times and it was awesome, but as my son is older now, we want to downsize the amount of stuff we bring. This stroller does take some getting used to as far as folding and unfolding it. I actually jammed my finger really bad the first time I tried folding it down. It folds up nice and compact and takes up so much less room in our van.
customer_reviews.author: A. Magee

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller if you have tall kids that have outgrown their regular stroller. Easy to fold and store. Easy enough to take into stores. Negatives: The handles feel a little cheap. The wheel base is close together, so when you go for walks, you hit the wheels. These negatives are not enough for me to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Speechless.... Truly amazing. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly an amazing product. It's perfect in so many ways. The size folded is just short of magic. I paid full price for this item, not compensated for this review. I love it more than the $800 stroller I already had. Buy it, don't think twice. It's beyond worth it. I'd give 10 stars if I could. Ignore the reviews that say it doesn't fold up right. Do it 10 times as practice, and you'll have no problem. It's awesome. High 5 to the genius that invented it.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Compact, lightweight but rickety and flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Super lightweight, folds down to small (airplane overhead compartment compatible) dimensions. Cons: Pretty rickety. Good for malls, smooth surfaces, but forget cobblestones or gravel. The "sunshade" is a joke, it shields nothing, no wind, sun or rain. In even the slightest wind, it folds back on itself towards the person pushing the stroller. Basically an umbrella stroller with a much higher price tag. You pay for the clever small design.
customer_reviews.author: HMama

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is great! So cool looking too. I constantly have moms coming up to me like where did you get this! So easy to fold, so light and barely takes any space in my trunk. We took a flight and the flight attendants recognized the stroller and told me that I can just wheel the baby on and put the stroller in the overhead bin. I wish I had gotten this stroller with my oldest, but I was being cheap. This stroller is so worth the money. I regret not getting it sooner! But at least my youngest can enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Nai Len

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for our first trip with our little one. It folded easily and we got though airport Security With ease. We were turning heads when we folded it up and placed it in the bin for the x ray machine. The recline worked out nicely for when our little guy napped, as did the foot adjustment. Our little guy was only 6 month old when we got this for our trip. It’s easy to maneuver with one hand and it rolled over uneven pavement in NOLA really well. I would Definitely Recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: Steffany

customer_reviews.title: Beat choice in compact strollers
customer_reviews.text: So glad I went with this stroller for our second child. So easy to transport and doesn't take space in the trunk. The only small issue is taking the stroller down and up isn't quite as fast I was expecting. Material is strong yet thin enough to let air through the back seat. Very easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.author: Elliot Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Best impulse buy I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on Prime Day and I am so glad I went for it. We live in Madrid and it's the perfect city stroller. Love that my 2.5 year old can ride in it with room to spare. Folds like a dream. I bought a luggage strap on Amazon for $8 and attached that to it to make a carry strap. Sun shade is kind of a joke but we just put a hat on our toddler when it's super sunny out. It works fine on cobblestone (not as good as full size strollers but still works), can be folded in seconds, is super light, and is machine-washable. What more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: PugLover

customer_reviews.title: Loved it for our trip!
customer_reviews.text: I took this stroller on a trip to LA from DC. I wanted something my 4 year old to be able to ride on. She fit very comfortably. We even took the stroller to Disneyland and I couldn’t have been happier. I recommend this to anyone. I had to check the stroller at the gate At the airport and I saw the guys throw it into the cart that goes in the airplane. I was angry they had broken it. When I got the stroller it was perfectly fine. Love the front suspension when it went over curbs and bumps. It was totally worth the $200+
customer_reviews.author: Mayra D

customer_reviews.title: If you can afford this, you should get it.
customer_reviews.text: It took me some time to remember exactly how to fold this thing up. But I love it and would totally buy it all over again. Perfect for traveling because this thing folds up to be so small that it very easily fits under an airplan seat. We took this with us to NYC and it was convenient to be able to fold it up while traveling the subway with its crowdedness and tons of stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Love how compact this stroller is and how easy it is to open and collapse back down! My wife didn't want to spend this much money on a stroller but even she has fallen in love with it!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Henke

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea but I hated this stroller from the first try to open it. So much pain in the... - you definitely need instruction to pack/unpack it. It's definitely NOT a breeze to fold/unfold it, in comparison to other brands like Recaro easylife or pegperego pliko mini. Those strollers are so intuitive and easy to open/close even with one hand. THIS one is quite a challenge - even with two hands it is more like a puzzle. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Irca_21

customer_reviews.title: This is worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: If have any because of the price. Throw it out the window. Because when you have a diaper bag, carry on and a small child in an airport. Going from end of it to the other whatever clock AM. You will praising God that you have this exact stroller to put your child in. Safe, secure and comfortable. THIS IS A LIFESAVER WHEN YOU'RE TRAVELING WITH SMALL CHILDREN!
customer_reviews.author: Aknative

customer_reviews.title: This stroller is awesome! It folds so small
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is awesome! It folds so small. My daughter likes watching me fold and unfold it. Another huge plus: it fits into the back of our Burley bike trailer! It handles surprisingly smoothly for a stroller that can fold so small. There are only two cons: the sunshade is not really useful, and it doesn't recline. This wasn't a big deal for us, since we already have the Summer Infant shade which goes right over the top, and my daughter doesn't nap in the stroller so we don't need the recline.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleR

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 4th floor walkup and this stroller is great paired with this carring strap  the only drawbacks are that the handles are a bit low and it would be more comfortable if they were an an angle, also the stroller is a bit wobbly, and you need both hands to close it so you wouldn't be able to keep a hand on your toddler and close/open it at the same time, I use it for small errands where I wont need to take the little one out like picking up the kids from school.
customer_reviews.author: Le Ferrer

customer_reviews.title: Smallest but not necessarily better
customer_reviews.text: Over all it is a good stroller. I bought this, along with two other compact travel strollers( Besrey airplane stroll and Graco jettsetter). This one was the smallest by far, but weight wise they all were similar. This one was the hardest to fold and unfold requiring both hands. Over all I liked the Besrey stroller the best and returned the others. I felt the Besrey get more stroll and was still small and easy to fold. Better for quick on the go travel.
customer_reviews.author: Naaman L Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller ever! Folds perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Best stroller I’ve ever used. I have three boys. Oldest two are teenagers. I bought this for ease of use on airplane. It’s perfect. It folds into a little square. It’s easy to maneuver. My three year old fits in it great. I hooked a shoulder strap to it and cM carry it into restaurants and stores. I wish I had only this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany C

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: Took us some time to write this review. Don’t waste your money. Footrest broke. I reached out to manufacturer and they weren’t able to replace, nor did they have a solution. Spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: misty

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fold but horrible to use
customer_reviews.text: This item is horrible. At first sight it looks great but it does not work well at all and is flimsy! I’m so disappointed. We tried it out at the park and I regret it. Wanted to use for Mardi Gras and now I’ll have to find something else! Super disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Arbour

customer_reviews.title: More compact imposible
customer_reviews.text: The best lightweight stroller for travel and quick runs. It unfolds super easy, the folding is sometimes harder, we seem to need something to push it towards to, to be able to fold it, like some kind of wall or obstacle so the front wheels don't roll. It cleans super easy and always is a head turner. We've been approached in the street and been asked about it. Very happy with it truly.
customer_reviews.author: Graciela Leal

customer_reviews.title: Best compact stroller out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty neat product for sure. No assembly required (perfect) and it does exactly what it says it will do. It will fold up into a tiny square and unfold into a pretty decent size stroller (much larger than those 20-40 umbrella strollers you see at stores). I you are looking for a travel stroller, this is it. Highly recommend. Pros: light weight, looks sleek (not cheap looking), pretty easy to extend and fold (less than a minute first time around). Cons: it’s wobbly and not as small as I thought it would be. Can’t fit into a backpack or a large purse.. more like a camper backpack or small duffel bag.
customer_reviews.author: Merv

customer_reviews.title: Travels must have for kids.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great travel companion. We have a primary stroller that is not travel friendly (specially at airport. We specifically bought this to travel abroad. Fits in the aircraft. The build is good but at times feels flimsy when compared to full scale strollers but that is expected. Still far better than any umbrella stroller. Folds great and best of all, it’s wheels rotate great.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bokhari

customer_reviews.title: travel stroller
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this stroller for our trip to Europe two months ago. I already have uppa baby g luxe but it doesn't fold good for travelling. Pockit folds easily and it fits in my luggage, and you can even bring it inside the airplane since it's so small when folded. Child cant really lay down and the sun protector is not really great hence the 4 stars. Its so lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jelena M.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This compact stroller is a great solution to small spaces. Much more comfortable than an umbrella stroller, this small stroller can literally go into my backpack and still leave room for stuff. Comfortable and durable; totally recommend this for anyone looking for a small stroller that is easily to use and comfortable. Only complaint would be the shade, which is pretty flimsy but not the main point of this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: C. Liao

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on a sub par product
customer_reviews.text: The main reason to buy this product is light weight and folds up small, the reasons you would continue to use it like easy to roll, heavy duty etc are 0 stars. The stroller is flimsy, the handles bend very easily and it sticks when opening and closing. This stroller is definately not worth the price that is charged.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Christy

customer_reviews.title: Small but does the job
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. It takes up very little room in my compact car and i can pull it out whenever we need it. We just came back from a family trip to Tokyo where it was indispensable. If we needed to break it down to put it in a bag we could but even when using it it didn’t take up much room. In the airport you can bring it on the plane as carry on. We will see how it lasts but i spoke to another family that had an earlier model (two years older) and they still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Los Torretti-Romeros

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great travel stroller - light weight, folds easy, truly does fit in a 737 overhead bin (Southwest airlines plane) and is easy to push around. Storage under seats there but is minimal But... Our toddler hated it. He had no leg support like he is used to in his regular stroller. We ended up returning it, even though I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Boatwaco

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice stroller. While it folds very easily into its "standard" fold, it is somewhat harder (for me at least) to get it into it's "compact" fold. Very easy to transport - I have it in a backpack that I had laying around. Pretty amazing engineering from my POV.
customer_reviews.author: richieggg

customer_reviews.title: NOT for TALL babies/toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller BUT the upper back straps were lower than my 2,2 month old daughter, making her shoulder blades rest on the plastic buckle of the upper stripe. The manufacturer should make openings on the back rest fabric for taller babies. Sad to say but had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Chiara McCluskey

customer_reviews.title: Great design and compact but...
customer_reviews.text: It’s not side walk friendly. Which I am saying if it come to cube or cement that is 2 inch height, you will need to push down the handle for front wheel to go up. But because it have some many joints to make it compact, you will need to push down a lot more as it’s too flex. Design are great, compact but it not my type of stroller. It’s great for flat road with no up or crack road or cement. Sun block is small, does not cover much.
customer_reviews.author: ANDY C LEE

customer_reviews.title: CONVENIENT travel stroller
customer_reviews.text: This is obviously only for frequent travelers. Anyone who travels frequently and long distance knows that a stroller is a must but such a pain to have to leave it at gate and wait until it comes out so then you're the last in customs line. This makes my travel life much easier. I just carry it on. Nice and sturdy and cute too.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Broken frame. No response from company.
customer_reviews.text: Super late response, but since I am getting no response from the manufacturer, I guess I'll pist here . I purchase this stroller for our family trips but never had a chance to use it until recently. Took it out of the box brand new and used it a few times for local city short trips and after a few short trips, we noticed a disconnect from a joint which causes the stroller to collapse while in use. My daughter was approx 15 pounds at the time of issue. I attempted to reach out to the manufacturer and never received a response. Beware of this product and customer support issues.
customer_reviews.author: flora

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase for Frequent Travelers
customer_reviews.text: We are frequent travelers and it has been 15th flight my 17-months-old toddler has taken with me. I wish I would have bought long time ago. The best purchase we ever made. It is sturdy, folds very easy, great design and it can literally fit in a grocery re-usable bag. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kateryna

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Great for traveling. We were able to easily carry it on to an airplane and fold up and put in overhead storage in seconds. Also fits nicely in a suitcase if you want to check it. Flight attendants were really impressed with it! A little flimsier than your normal stroller, but that is due to the many joints needed to properly fold it. We purchased for the foldability of this product, so in that respect this is a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: Airaco

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller for travel but not a good fit for daily use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller thinking itd be good for daily use but sadly I didn't read the description close enough. It easy to fold and unfold once you get used to it. I love how small it folds unfortunately, it's not a good fit for my baby because we dont travel much and I wanted something for daily use. The seat doesn't recline which is a con for me. the sun shade is of no use specially if you live in a place like Texas lol. Anyways! to sum this review down - I would recommend you to buy this stroller if you are on the run and travelling alot. If not! it's not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Genuine Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller! Folds up and sets up so easy. Love the recline and sun shade. The buckle is also very nice and comfortable for baby! A little heavier then expected but still light for a stroller. Rides so smooth with the front suspension. Also the storage underneath although small fits the diaper bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great travel stroller
customer_reviews.text: We bought this over a year ago and only now remembered to review it. Pre-COVID, this was great. We took it to the mall, traveling, even walking around the neighborhood because it was so convenient. So much easier than messing with our big stroller. Would definitely recommend to anyone traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Nursing mama

customer_reviews.title: Good luck if your stroller breaks. You’re on your own!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller was great while it lasted. I bought it 2017 March and in 2019 November the leg broke off while I was entering public transportation with my kid in it. I had to discard it on the street because I couldn’t walk with a child, and a broken stroller. Customer service was useless since I no longer had the stroller in my possession even though I had these photos from the bus where it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for my first baby trip out of state, so we didn't have to check the stroller. This stroller is lighter than my baby! Was very difficult to fold down at first, so I recommend trying out at home several times (kinda tight, it loosens up as you use more). However, we got so many compliments and people asking where we got this. I use it for everyday shopping and errands as well because it's light and takes up NO room in the car! Overall, must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh I don’t travel enough for this stroller
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy hard to fold up and the deal breaker is that it doesn’t recline which it was on the questions and they statement it did
customer_reviews.author: alexandra torres

customer_reviews.title: Disney Proof
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic! It survived the wilds of air travel, 20 walking miles in two days at two Disney parks and then the circus at Orlando airport. One of the best features is it’s ability to fold so small, I can collapse it on the jetway and then thow it in the overhead bin. It still looks brand new after the chaos of Disney and my daughter was comfortable the entire time
customer_reviews.author: B. C.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed:(
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed of this product. I had a couple incidents where the seat didn't locked even though we heard the click. It's kinda difficult to fold and the one that we got doesn't fold completely. I'm a small person and I still think this a very small stroller I don't recomend it for tall parents. I had it for a couple months and the tires look pretty beat up alreasy. ( we dinr go out too often) Honestly I think this stroller won't last us for too long. I'm going to have to start researching for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Fits bigger kids and great for travel!
customer_reviews.text: "What stroller is that?" The daily question we got during our recent trip to NYC. Great for folding quickly to get down subway stairs and on the plane. We didnf have to check it at the gate. Highly recommend it!!! My son is is 2 years and big for his age, 41 inches and 37 pounds. He fit comfortably in this stroller and even fell asleep a few times in it...in the middle of NYC hustle and bustle! I've posted a photo of the easier fold but it can fold even smaller when lifting the rear legs first. Oh and my husband LOVED it too!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Is super light. The folding mechanism is not as easy ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid product. I didn’t have high expectations from this but this stroller delivered. We just came back from a 2 week trip to Asia and this striker was indispensable through airports, transfers, train stations and in general. Used it for my 4 yr old daughter as well as 8 month infant. Having 4 wheels, this did not flip over cracks, crevices and brick streets. Handled very well. Is super light. The folding mechanism is not as easy and fluid as you would expect, but solid otherwise. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a day trip or even a trip to the mall
customer_reviews.text: folds and unfolds easily, compact and stores perfectly into my car. Almost fits under the seat. My only complaint is that it needs a carrying handle and needs to be about 50% lighter. Other than that, it's a great little stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R

product_meta.title: Pockit Lightweight Stroller
product_meta.description: Color:Monument Black| Style:PockitWith its exceptional design innovation, the Pockit is the 2014 Guinness world records? Most compact stroller. When folded, it is the smallest and most compact stroller currently available on the market, 11.8" X 7" x 13.8" To be precise. For parents with a passion for city travel and exploring, the Pockit is the quint essential choice. With the ability to switch from pushing to carrying in seconds, it's ideal for trips by train, plane or simply visiting your favorite cafes. Note: This is a specific travel stroller which does not have a recline.
feature_bullets: WORLD’S SMALLEST FOLDING STROLLER - With its innovative two-step folding design, the Pockit is the 2014 Guiness World Records most compact stroller folding down to 11.8” x 7” x 13.8” and a weight of 9.5 pounds
SMALL BUT STRONG - Built using high quality, durable materials, the Pockit can hold a child from 6 months up to 55 pounds as well as 11 pounds of gear in its convenient storage basket

PERFECT FOR DAY TRIPS OR EXTENDED TRAVEL - For families with a passion for local or overseas travel and exploring, Pockit is the quintessential choice as it stows away easily in any plane or train overhead bin, or just stowing away in the car

SECURE, ADJUSTABLE HARNESS SYSTEM - The Pockit is equipped with a secure safety belt and protective comfort pads that can be set at different height and fastened or loosened for a cozy and secure fit allowing the stroller to grow with your child

OTHER VALUABLE FEATURES - Easy, one-hand pushing and steering, sliding back panel with adjustable torso length, lightweight yet sturdy aluminum frame, lockable front swivel wheels, overhead canopy, rear wheel parking brake, and padded handlebars

specifications.Additional product features: 2014 Guinness World Records™ most compact stroller.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,050 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
